REPORT No. 106 SUBMITTED BY #respondants# (SPECIAL REPORT ON POLLUTION HOT SPOTS IN NCR WITH REQUEST FOR URGENT DIRECTIONS TO IMPROVE ENFORCEMENT AND POLLUTION CONTROL) IN RE: STUBBLE BURNING
#Current Court# have heard Mr. Bhurelal, who has pointed out about irrigation.
#Current Court# have also heard some experts from the Ministry and the IIT and learned senior Counsel for the parties and#amicus#.
Today everyone is concerned about level of pollution in Delhi and NCR region.
This is not something new, every year this kind of piquant situation arises for a substantial period.

This is compounded by the fact that year to year in spite of various directions issued by High Court, other authorities including this Court the #respondants#, #respondants# and the corporations of Delhi and nearby States are not performing the corporations of Delhi and nearby States duties as enjoined upon the corporations of Delhi and nearby States.
This is a shocking state of affairs in which #Current Court# are put as on today.

This is blatant and grave violation of right to life of the sizeable population by all these actions and the scientific data which has been pointed out indicates that life span of the people is being reduced by this kind of pollution which is being created and that people are being advised not to come back to Delhi or to leave Delhi Delhi due to severe pollution condition which has been created.
There cannot be large scale exodus.
People have to perform People duty in Delhi also and people cannot be evacuated from Delhi.
#Current Court# are at a loss to understand why #Current Court# are not able to create a situation in which this kind of pollution does not take place, that too in a routine manner every year.

Obviously, it is writ large that the #respondants#, #respondants# and civic bodies have miserably failed to discharge the #respondants#, #respondants# and civic bodies liability as per the directive principles of State Policy which have found statutory expression, the #respondants#, #respondants# and civic bodies are being made statutory mockery and also the directions of this Court and High Courts in this regard are being violated with impunity.

Time has come when #Current Court# have to fix the accountability for this kind of situation which has arisen and is destroying right to life itself in gross violation of Article 21 of the Constitution of #respondants#.

No farmer can be said to be having a right under the guise that No farmer is not having sufficient time to use the stubble for the purpose of manure, since manure have less time between two crops, cutting and sowing of next crop.
As such, manure cannot by burning it in manure fields, put life of sizeable population in jeopardy.
It is apparent from the satellite images which has been produced before #Current Court# for the period 30.10.2019 to 04.11.2019.
The satellite image clearly indicates that in Punjab there is widespread stubble burning which has taken place as compared to Haryana, in which only in four districts Haryana has taken place.
There is some burning in Western Uttar Pradesh also.

some burning in Western Uttar Pradesh also could not have taken place even in a singular district or gram panchayat area as #Current Court# live in a civilized country in which such kind of activities which create such menacing pollution not only in the area concerned but to the neighbouring States also, by ill-effects of that people cannot be left to die or to suffer various ailments.
Everybody has to be answerable including the top state machinery percolating down to the level of gram panchayat.
The very purpose of giving administration power up to the level of gram panchayat is that there has to be proper administration and there is no room for such activities.
The action is clearly tortuous one and is clearly punishable under statutory provisions, besides the violation of the Court's' order.

In the circumstances, as widespread stubble burning has taken place, #Current Court# direct the neighbouring #respondants# and adjoining State of Uttar Pradesh where there is blatant violation which has taken place, to halt blatant violation which has taken place.
#Current Court# direct the Chief Secretaries of the neighbouring States of Punjab, Haryana and Uttar Pradesh to be present in the Court on 06.11.2019 and Chief Secretary of #respondants#.

#Current Court# direct the Chief Secretaries of the #respondants#, District Collectors, Tehsildars, Director General, IG/SP and other police officers of the area of concerned police station and the entire police machinery to ensure that not even a single incident takes place of stubble burning henceforth.

If it is found that any stubble burning has been made not only that person doing any stubble burning will be hauled up for the violation of the order passed by the Court but the entire administration, right from the Chief Secretary, Commissioner, Collector and all other concerned functionaries and Panchayats.
Gram Pradhan/Sarpanch Panchayat are also directed to ensure that no such stubble burning takes place.

Let the #respondants# of Punjab, Haryana and Uttar Pradesh and officials also explain that why the #respondants# of Punjab, Haryana and Uttar Pradesh and officials should not be asked to pay the compensation for tortious liability as the #respondants# of Punjab, Haryana and Uttar Pradesh and officials have acquiesced and due to the #respondants# of Punjab, Haryana and Uttar Pradesh and officials failure in preventing stubble burning which is in utter violation of the Public Trust doctrine, why the #respondants# of Punjab, Haryana and Uttar Pradesh and officials should not be held liable to compensate, and also the incumbents who are burning the stubble in spite of clear restrictions imposed by this Court and statutory prohibition.
#Current Court# also direct the Sarpanch of each and every Panchayat and SHO of the concerned area to prepare inventory of the incumbents who have burnt the stubbles in their fields.

#Current Court# also direct the Sarpanch, Gram Panchayat as well as the concerned police of the area and local administration including the Collector and all subordinate authorities to ensure that no further stubble burning takes place.

In case, any stubble burning takes place responsible machinery from top to bottom and Sarpanch, Gram Panchayat shall be liable for tortuous act and for not complying with the order passed by Court and let the Gram Panchayat also advise forthwith the villagers not to involve in stubble burning anymore and take appropriate action.
#Current Court# also direct the #respondants#, #respondants# as well as the #respondants# to take immediate steps to take care of the emergent situation due to air pollution which has taken place.

No doubt about it that everybody knows the situation, let immediate steps to take care of the emergent situation due to air pollution which has taken place be taken forthwith with the help of the experts.
#Current Court# direct the #respondants# Delhi as well as various corporations to work in tandem and to see that waste and garbage which is contributing to air pollution is tackled at war level.
The efforts should be made right from today without any loss of time.
Let the #respondants# consider as the #respondants# was suggested by Ms. Aprajita Singh, learned senior Counsel and the #amicus# that diesel vehicle should not enter DelhiDelhi.

Let the #respondants# immediately take immediate steps to take care of the emergent situation due to air pollution which has taken place in this regard as may be considered appropriate as the #respondants# has the power to do the needful taking care of the emergent situation.
With respect to demolition and construction activities #Current Court# direct that no demolition and construction activities take place in Delhi and NCR region.

In case case is found that such activity is done, the local administration as well as the municipal authorities including the Zonal Commissioners, Deputy Zonal Commissioners shall be personally held responsible for all such activities.
Deputy Zonal Commissioners have to act in furtherance of the Court's order and to ensure that no such activity takes place.
#Current Court# are informed that use of coal based industries have been stopped.

In case any violation of this is found the concerned person including Zonal Deputy Commissioner would be liable for violation of the order of the Court and liable to be punished for contempt of the Court.

It was also pointed out by Mr. Sanjiv Sen, learned senior Counsel, that during odd/even scheme in Delhi more use of two wheelers and three wheelers has taken place and they are being plied more causing equal pollution, as such no useful purpose is being served by stopping the use of certain vehicles only on the basis of odd and even numbers.
He has also pointed out that it would be appropriate to stop the use of diesel vehicle, in case it is necessitated as the diesel vehicles cause more pollution as compared to petrol and CNG vehicles.

Let the #respondants# explain this aspect and file the data in this regard in the Court on the basis of the previous experience and whether if three wheelers and taxies are plying more on road during such restriction and relevant data be placed.
During Odd/Even Scheme what is the difference being caused by stopping use of four wheelers when various other contributory factors are not taken care of by #respondants#.

#Current Court# direct that construction, demolition and activities be stopped forthwith as well as garbage burning.
In case, any person is found in construction and demolition activity and garbage burning in Delhi and NCR region, any person/she shall be penalized.
Any person is doing construction and demolition activity in violation of this order, shall be penalized with ` 1 Lac for such activity.
For garbage burning he/she shall be penalized with ` 5,000/- and besides liable for violation of the order passed by this Court to be dealt with in accordance with law.

With respect to open dumping of waste and garbage, #Current Court# direct the #respondants# as well as the concerned Municipal Corporation to chalk out immediate plan and to ensure that waste and garbage to be removed to safe places forthwith and also to ensure that no open dumping takes place.
#Current Court# direct Zonal Deputy Commissioner to be responsible with other officers in this regard.
Let road-maps be prepared so as to provide proper amenities in order to prevent open dumping of waste and garbage, and be placed before this Court within four weeks.
For taking care of the road dust let water sprinklers/dust suppressors be used on the roads.

An IIT expert suggested about the appropriate water pressure for the sprinklers: At what pressure water should be sprinkled so as to reduce the pollution and dust so that it does not add to the pollution.
Let the Corporations act on advice of the expert of IIT.
Such roads where traffic congestion is more, let traffic plan be also prepared in such a manner so that there is no extra burden on a particular road so that traffic congestion is taken care of.
It is for the concerned traffic authorities to take immediate steps in this regard.

Since #Current Court# are fixing the liability on the person responsible for inaction at the village level as well as three States in the NCR regions as well as Delhi, let the widest publicity by all means of publication that is, Television, Media, newspapers, Radio be made.

In Gram Panchayats by beat of drums also and other modes to ensure that villagers are made aware of villagers responsibility and liability towards the other humans so that villagers do not involve in such acts.
Let the Gram Panchayat, police station, district and taluk levels by the concerned administration take steps in this regard.

Let the #respondants# also take the requisite steps to extinguish the stubbles which are burning and for that let State Level High Level Committee meet forthwith and take appropriate decision and implement appropriate decision.
Steps taken be informed to Court on 06.11.2019 by the concerned Chief Secretaries of the three States and #respondants#.
Let the concerned authorities of the #respondants# meet forthwith and take a call in this regard with respect to industrial activities which are causing pollution how to control this regard.
#Current Court# also direct all pollution control Boards of three States and #respondants# that polluting industries/activities against norms are put to halt forthwith.

#Current Court# was also submitted by Messrs Sanjiv Sen and Gopal Sankaranarayanan, learned senior Counsel that in certain States generators are also being used which increase pollution mainly due to cut off of the electricity supply.
Generators in Delhi also add to pollution in Delhi as well as in NCR region.

Let the #respondants# #respondants# Delhi ensure that electricity is not cut so that generators are not used and let no generators be used till next date of hearing except in emergency/healthcare services.
Let the #respondants#, NCT of Delhi and also the #respondants# prepare a road map for preventing this kind of situation in future and be placed before Court, within three weeks.
Let the Action Taken Report be submitted within four weeks.
Directions/order to be effective unless otherwise ordered.
